title: Unwanted "update addons automatically" setting selected
content:
I have never used this setting. When a addon update is released, I want to see release notes. I want to see what has been improved, fixed,if and how the options have been altered, etc.

Several weeks ago this happened, and I found seven items in the "recent updates" section.

I just happened to go to the went to the addons manager today, and realized it had been selected again, with another addon in recent updates.

Does this have something to do with a browser update automatically making the selection?

The settings have the option for notifying if a browser update is available? Why not have the same for addons?

title: Firefox keeps randomly moving focused tabs to the end
content:
When I go to view an already open tab it will sometimes randomly move it to the very end of my tabs all the way to the right. I don't want it to move tabs without my intervention. Clicking on a tab should keep it in place.

This has been an issue for about 2 months now. I'm not sure what's causing it or even if it's entirely a Firefox issue as I have noticed something similar happen in another program with tabs that I use often. It still seems like a Firefox issue in that moving a tab all the way to the end is a very specific task that can't normally be done accidentally.

Is there a way to prevent this from happening or has anyone figured it out?

This person has the same issue: https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/discussions/stop-reordering-my-tabs/td-p/93219

title: Taskbar Preview Shows Multiple Blank Windows or Tabs
content:
After using Firefox 138.0.4 64-bit (most recent version) for a few hours I get this kind of glitch on my taskbar preview in Windows 11. Please see the image. It especially happens when I unsleep the computer and leave Firefox running I think. I have already tried a refresh and reinstall. Now I'm trying to run firefox with no extensions/addons in safe mode. If that doesn't work I'm going to start thinking something is wrong with Windows 11. Was there something in about:config I shouldn't have touched involving multiple processes? (I think that resets with a reinstall/refresh anyway) Anyone know how to make this go back to normal? I can reboot to fix it or restart explorer.exe in task manager but it comes back like this in a few hours of useage.

I'm sure I don't have anything else open. If I hover mouse over the blank "windows" I don't get any kind of tooltip and nothing changes but an X does appear. I can click it and nothing happens. Right and left clicking these windows does nothing. When I close Firefox they still remain. I closed Firefox and Firefox isn't running in the task manager anywhere, yet the blank windows remain.

content:

Thank you.

title: Megjelenítési probléma a legújabb 139-es verzióval
content: Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS -n használom a firefox-t. Játszom egy browser-es játékkal (GOT), amit hogy ha teljes képernyős módba teszek (a játékon belül, nem F11-el) akkor mintha egy piros függönyön keresztül néznék, minden szép piros lesz. Működik, színes, csak pirosas lesz minden. A sejtésem az, hogy ez ugyanaz a piros "függöny" mint amikor a képernyőn dokkolok ablakokat balra,jobbra, felülre és megjelenik egy pirosas keret ami mutatja, hogy most fogok dokkolni és jelzi, hogy hova. Ez csak egy sejtés, de hátha közelebb visz a hiba megtalálásához. A következő megfigyeléseim vannak: - addig amíg nem teszem teljes képernyősre a játékot, minden rendben. Viszont miután teljes képernyőből visszaváltok böngésző nézetbe, a piros függöny megmarad. - kipróbáltam ugyanazon a gépen más böngészőkkel nem jelentkezik ez a hiba - !!! kipróbáltam a 138.0b9 -es Firefox verzióval: nem jelentkezik a hiba. !!! - Más gépeken is (Ubuntu) stabilan reprodukálható: Firefox 139 pirosas lesz teljes képernyős módban, de sem a FireFox 138, sem más böngészők nem produkálják ezt a hibát.

title: Problem with typing Korean and space
content:
When typing Korean letters (in macOS, it happens regardless of whether it's a two-set or three-set keyboard, in Windows, it only happens with a three-set keyboard) and then typing a punctuation mark or moving the cursor in the middle of a line, presssing the space bar cause a space be added behind the cursor.

For example, if I type `가나.` and type spacebar and then `다`, The result is supposed to `가나.(space)다`, but actually `가나.다(space)`. As a more clear example, if I type `가나` and then move the cursor between `가` and `나`, and type space and `다`, the result will be `가다 나`, not `가 다나`.

I found this on several websites, both of which filled the text with event handling inside a div element. However, some sites had the symptom a year ago, while others started showing the symptom in the latest version of Firefox. (Maybe 139.0 and later)

title: Pushy and unwanted software suggestions
content: When i browse using Firefox it has started to recommend I install extensions and use other Firefox features. This is entirely unwelcome and unwanted. It feels suspicious to be suggested third party software, and it feels invasive to get contextual feature suggestions. Please stop these spam advertisements.
creator: DanielDaniel
